DOC.brief_summary: Obese patients have an increased risk for developing severe metabolic disorders. This risk can only partly be reduced by weight reduction. The investigators have in a pilot study investigated if removal of abdominal fat (visceral) in addition to weight loss has additional beneficial effects on the metabolic profile and weight loss. This study aims to further investigate if removal of abdominal fat (major omentum) leads to beneficial metabolic effects.
DOC.brief_title: Effects of Different Surgical Methods to Treat Obesity
DOC.criteria: Body mass index over 40 kg/m2 Body mass index over 35 kg/m2 with obesity associated comorbidities such as type 2 diabetes and/or additional cardiovascular risk factors
